Note: The first motet with English words
_description: A renunciation of the world — twenty-two lines, 8 couplets and two triplets

CamCCC8.First Lines:
Worldes blisse haue god dayNou fram min heide wand a
                    way…
CamCCC8.Last Lines:
…thech min herte riȝt loue þeȝwas herte blod
                    was ssed for me
CamCCC8.Note:
Formerly p. 457; accompanied by musical notation; followed by motet
                        (2528).

NLS18721.Transcription:
…A iesu þin lyli heuedWith sarpe þornes is
                    beweuedþi faire face is all be spateWith spotele an blod is al be
                    watffro þi crune to þi toþi bodi is ful of peine &
                    woLord of þi peines þat ben so sueteLat my soule þer
                    inne han hete…
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 42.
